p: In the current study, as shown in Table 3, equisetin exhibited antibacterial activities against the Gram-positive bacteria B. subtilis, S. aureus and MRSA with MIC’s of 8–16 μg mL −1 and no activity against the Gram-negative bacteria E.coli, P. aeruginosa or pathogenic fungus C. albicans. In addition to the antibacterial activities equisetin has shown phytotoxicity and inhibited the in vitro recombinant integrase enzyme which is necessary for HIV replication [ 27].
